item.title: East Timor | A dream that began almost half a century ago has come true
item.description: Timorese President, José Ramos-Horta, stated yesterday that Timor-Leste's accession to the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) is the realization of a dream, which began almost half a century ago. "Today, we realized a dream that began almost half a century ago, a vision of regional belonging that predates our own independence. I remember discussing this idea when I was a young man of 25", said the head of state, quoted in a statement released to the press. Timor-Leste joined ASEAN yesterday during the Asian organization's summit of heads of state and government, taking place in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, becoming its 11th member state. "When we formally presented the candidacy, in 2011, the path was not yet defined and required great perseverance. This success belongs to many", stated Ramos-Horta. The Nobel Peace Prize winner, who witnessed the moment of accession in Kuala Lumpur, expressed his “deep gratitude” to all ASEAN leaders and gave special recognition to the support of former Indonesian President Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono. "I also thank all Timorese leaders, past and present, including Prime Minister Xanana Gusmão, for their visionary leadership and tireless efforts to improve the well-being of our people. This is a victory for the entire nation, a moment of immense pride and shared achievement", added the Timorese President. ASEAN was created in 1967 by Indonesia, Singapore, Thailand, Malaysia and the Philippines, and was later joined by Brunei Darussalam, Cambodia, Laos, Myanmar and Vietnam. With 676.6 million inhabitants, ASEAN is the third most populous region in the world, after India and China.

item.title: Education | Defended creation of learning vouchers
item.description: Chan Lai Kei, a deputy linked to the Fujian community, questioned the Government about the idea of ​​creating learning vouchers, outside the education system, which would be awarded annually to students with economic difficulties, in order to alleviate the burden on families. According to a written statement, the deputy argued that, currently, the subsidies granted by the Government take place in a school context, but the courses available in schools may not meet the needs of all students. In turn, the Continuous Development and Improvement Programme, aimed at courses outside the school system, is only aimed at residents over 15 years old, meaning that anyone aged between 6 and 14 has to pay for courses outside of school in full, without any support. According to Chan Lai Kei, the lack of financial support in this area means that there are limitations to the development of students' potential, also making improvements in terms of social diversity and the achievement of greater educational equity in the long term difficult.

item.title: Black Sand | Car enters restaurant and leaves six injured
item.description: An out-of-control Lamborghini entered the window of a restaurant in Areia Preta, leaving six people injured. The case happened on Saturday afternoon, and the injured, including the driver, customers and restaurant workers, were considered by authorities to be in a “stable” situation. According to the report in the newspaper Ou Mun, the 60-year-old driver claimed to have made a mistake by pressing the accelerator pedal instead of the brake, which led to him losing control of the vehicle. The balloon test indicated that the driver had not consumed alcohol. In turn, the restaurant owner complained about the damage caused and also about the impossibility of continuing to operate the business in the near future, due to the need for major works. Authorities indicted the driver for causing physical harm through negligence, punishable by up to two years in prison. Alcohol | Driver detained for causing accident A 50-year-old man was arrested after causing an accident while driving drunk, with a level of 1.71 grams of alcohol per liter of blood. The case was revealed on Saturday, although the accident had happened on Wednesday morning. The accident was declared when authorities were called to Avenida Doutor Henry Fok, due to a rear-end collision between a light vehicle and another. However, at the scene, authorities suspected that one of the drivers had consumed alcoholic beverages, so they carried out a balloon test, which showed a result of 1.71 grams of alcohol per liter of blood. The man confessed to drinking alcohol, reporting that he had been drinking at work that morning. At the same time, he explained that he had been responsible for the accident, for not having maintained an appropriate safe distance.

item.title: Tourism | Best September ever since there are records
item.description: Despite last month's record, when the nine months of the year are considered, the number of visitors is still below what happened between January and September 2019, before the pandemic. Macau received almost 2.8 million visitors in September, 9.8 percent more than in the same period in 2024 and the highest figure ever for this month, it was announced Friday. The number of tourists passing through the territory was the highest for any month of September since the Directorate of Statistics and Census Services (DSEC) began compiling monthly data, in 1998, still during the Portuguese administration. However, more than 56 percent of visitors (1.56 million) arrived on organized tours and spent less than a day in the Macao SAR. In 2024, the Central Government announced a series of measures to support Macau, such as increasing the tax exemption limit for goods for personal use purchased by visitors from China. At the same time, the Chinese authorities expanded the list of places with “individual visas” to visit Hong Kong and Macau to 10 more cities in China. Furthermore, since January 1st, residents of the neighboring city of Zhuhai can visit Macau once a week and stay for up to seven days. As a result, the overwhelming majority (90.6 percent) of tourists arriving in Macau in September came from mainland China or Hong Kong, while fewer than 260,400 were international visitors. The city received a total of almost 29.7 million visitors in the first ten months, 14.5 percent more than in the same period in 2024 and the second highest figure ever for the start of a year. Exceptional numbers According to official data, the number of tourists passing through Macau was only surpassed between January and September 2019 – before the Covid-19 pandemic -, a period in which it registered more than 30.2 million visitors. On January 17, the director of Macau Tourism Services said she expected between 38 and 39 million visitors this year. In August, Maria Helena de Senna Fernandes set a goal of more than three million international visitors by 2025. In the first nine months of the year, Macau received almost 1.9 million tourists from abroad, 12.4 percent more than in the same period in 2024. Citizens of Saudi Arabia, Qatar, Kuwait, Bahrain and Oman began to be exempt from visas to enter the city from July 16th. Despite the increase in the number of tourists, the average consumption of each visitor in Macau, excluding casinos, fell 12.3 percent in the second quarter of the year, compared to the same period in 2024. In early May, DSEC pointed to the “change in the consumption pattern of visitors” as one of the main reasons for the 1.3 percent drop in Macau's economy between January and March. It was the first time that the territory's Gross Domestic Product shrank, in year-on-year terms, since the end of 2022, when the region began to lift restrictions due to the covid-19 pandemic. Macau received 34.9 million visitors last year, 23.8 percent more than the previous year, but still far from the record, 39.4 million, set in 2019, before the pandemic.

item.title: Inquiry | Young people defend their bet on the Light Rail
item.description: A survey carried out by the New Chinese Youth Association of Macau, among 647 young people, shows that 70.5 percent believe that this means of transport should continue to be developed. The results of the study will be presented this morning, but the association has already released some of the conclusions. Furthermore, 75.6 percent of respondents showed support for the construction of the Eastern Line, which is already being developed, and will connect Portas do Cerco and Pac On, crossing Zone A of Macau's New Landfills. However, the results presented show that most young people rarely use the metro, which currently only connects Seac Pai Van and Ilha da Montanha, via Taipa, with Barra Station, on the Macau Peninsula. Even so, in the last year, 58.7 percent said they had taken at least one metro trip.

item.title: Economy | Increasingly expensive food, rent and mortgages
item.description: Inflation accelerated in September for the third consecutive month, with increases in several basic goods and services, including fuel and education. Inflation accelerated in September, for the third consecutive month, at the same time that the consumer price index (IPC) fell again in the Interior, it was announced on Friday. The index in Macau rose 0.47 percent in September, year-on-year, 0.2 percentage points more than that recorded in August (0.27 percent), and the highest value since January (0.57 percent), according to official data. According to the Statistics and Census Services Directorate, the acceleration in inflation was mainly due to food products and non-alcoholic drinks (plus 0.56 percent). The cost of meals purchased outside the home rose 1.56 percent. Spending on apartment rent or mortgages grew by 0.85 percent and 0.63 percent, respectively, after the Macau Monetary Authority (AMCM) approved, on September 18, the first interest rate cut since the end of 2024. The territory's Legislative Assembly approved, in April 2024, the end of several taxes on the acquisition of housing, to “increase liquidity” in the real estate market, defended the Secretary for Economy and Finance, Lei Wai Nong, at the time. With the recovery in the number of visitors, the region recorded a 20.2 percent increase in the price of jewelry, goldsmithing and watches, popular products among tourists from mainland China. Most expensive trips Also, the cost of tours and hotels for Macau residents' overseas trips increased by 7.94 percent, while expenditure on education and vehicle fuel rose by 1.67 percent and 2.21 percent, respectively. In mainland China, by far Macau's largest trading partner, the CPI fell again by 0.3 percent in September, year-on-year, the second consecutive month of deflation (annual drop in consumer prices) and the sixth in the nine months of the year. Deflation reflects weakness in domestic consumption and investment and is particularly serious, as a fall in the price of assets, normally contracted using credit, generates an imbalance between the value of loans and bank guarantees. The value recorded in September surprised analysts, who predicted a smaller price contraction, of around 0.1 percent. The world's second largest economy continues to be under deflationary pressure, due to the combination of weak domestic demand and excess industrial capacity, aggravated by the trade war with the United States, which has made it difficult to dispose of inventories accumulated by companies. In Hong Kong, inflation remained unchanged, at 1.1 percent, in September.

item.title: Crime | Woman suspected of stealing statues from temples
item.description: A resident is suspected of having entered four temples in Taipa and Coloane and taken at least three statues of the god Tou Tei. The Cultural Institute calls on people to respect places and objects of worship A local resident has been arrested and is charged with the theft of at least three Tou Tei statues from temples in Taipa and Coloane. The case was disclosed on Friday by the Judiciary Police (PJ) and, in addition to the stolen statues, another 50 statues were found in the 38-year-old woman's home. The authorities were alerted to the case after receiving complaints about the disappearance of nine Tou Tei statues over four periods in Taipa and Coloane, with the value of the cultural objects varying between hundreds of patacas and 3,000 patacas. The god “To Tei Kong”, also known as “Foc Tac Cheng San” or “Tai Pak Kong” is one of the most popular cult figures among the Chinese community and is seen as the protector of some aspects such as life, health and wealth. Following investigations, the authorities found that the unemployed woman drove to the temples in question, between the 21st and 23rd of October, and was seen entering and leaving the places of worship. When she was approached by the authorities, she chose to remain silent, but searches of her house and car led to the discovery of three statues, which correspond to the description of the missing cult objects. However, authorities were surprised by the discovery of another 50 statues, also linked to cult objects. The PJ was unable to determine the origin of the statues, but did not rule out the possibility that they had also been stolen. Therefore, an alert was sent to local temples to check if they had any missing objects. IC shows concern After the case was made public, the Cultural Institute (IC) issued a statement expressing “high concern” and calling on “the public to value and respect culture and religious traditions in Macau, refraining from practices likely to cause damage to the value of cultural assets, thus avoiding breaking the law”. “The temples with their respective customs and beliefs constitute an important cultural heritage for Macau, and the statues, horizontal plaques with inscriptions and other components are an integral part of this heritage”, it was added. The IC also defended that “it has been carrying out regular inspections in several local temples, maintaining direct and constant communication” with those responsible for the temples about “the state of conservation of the buildings and objects”, including a register. The organization led by Deland Leong Wai Man also pointed out that people should not remove “any important objects or components on their own initiative” from temples and churches, because they risk being accused of committing crimes.

item.title: Salaries | Proposed increase of one pataca per hour
item.description: On the table, there was a discussion of an increase in the minimum wage of between one and three patacas per hour. The Executive led by Sam Hou Fai opted for the lower amount. The decision was justified with “the balance of a set of factors” After discussion by the Executive Council, the Government proposes an increase of one pataca per hour in the minimum wage. On the table was the possibility of increasing between one and three patacas, and the government opted for a lower growth rate. The proposal was revealed on Friday, through a press conference by the Executive Council, whose new spokesperson is Wong Sio Chak, now Secretary for Administration and Justice. According to the proposal, the hourly wage will rise from 34 patacas to 35 patacas, representing an increase of 2.9 percent. Regarding the daily calculation, the Executive Council presented the increase as an increase from 272 patacas to 280 patacas, taking into account eight hours of work. In weekly terms, the current salary of 1,632 patacas will increase to 1,680 patacas, while on a monthly basis the increase is from 7,072 patacas to 7,280 patacas. According to the Executive, the proposal was based on “the balance of a set of factors, namely the employers' business environment, the guarantee of workers' rights and interests and the ability of consumers to accept them”. Official estimates indicate that the increase will cover “around 18,200 people”, which means 4.4 percent of all workers, excluding domestic workers. Deletion defended At the press conference, the Government of Sam Hou Fai also defended the need for domestic workers to have a salary below the minimum wage. The position shows that Sam will not change this policy, maintaining Ho Iat Seng's options. The position was explained by the director of the Services for Labor Affairs (DSAL), Chan Un Tong: “When the law was established, the main premise was the ‘unique nature’ of domestic work and the need for the worker to ‘integrate’ into the employer’s family life”, explained Chan Un Tong. “However, even if this legislation does not apply to them, this does not mean that their rights are not protected”, he argued. Currently, DSAL allows the hiring of non-resident workers as domestic workers, as long as there is a minimum wage of 3,200 patacas. However, Chan pointed out that the median salary is around 3,800 patacas. Given this value, the director of DSAL considered that practice shows that even for these workers “there are mechanisms that guarantee reasonable remuneration”. JSF/Lusa

item.title: Edition celebrating 15 years of Oktoberfest Macau has already started
item.description: Another edition of Oktoberfest Macau began on Friday, which until November 2nd takes place at MGM Cotai. According to a statement from the gaming operator, this is an edition that makes “a toast to 15 years” of the event that has brought to the territory “the authentic flavor and spirit of the iconic German beer festival”. Oktoberfest Macau has received, over 15 years, more than 190 thousand participants. On Friday, at the opening ceremony, Kenneth Feng, president and CEO of MGM China, said that this party is “not only a celebration, but also a connection”. "It is this feeling of togetherness that has sustained the spirit of the festival for the past fifteen years, making it an eagerly-awaited annual celebration, filled with laughter and memories. This year, the festival will welcome its 200,000th guest, a true milestone that reflects MGM's long-standing commitment to developing cultural and tourism products for Macau," he added. Music and sausages Anyone who goes to Oktoberfest can be sure that they will find the typical German beer and sausages that are the delights of the party, and this year the Högl Fun Band returns, directly from Munich. This group promises to “take the stage with lively Bavarian melodies, leading the audience in chorus with the song that is the original theme of the festival”, the song “Nei Hou, Macau!”. In order to celebrate 15 years of existence, MGM created a “special photo booth” for this edition, so that participants can take themed photographs about Oktoberfest, in addition to the “Best Costume Award” debuting. Here, the public is invited “to dress up in themed costumes and fully embrace the spirit of Oktoberfest”. The space also offers activities designed for children. The party takes place until November 2nd, from 6pm to midnight, on the first terrace of MGM Cotai, and tickets for the event must be purchased.

item.title: Japan | New PM wants to “elevate alliance” with the USA
item.description: The new Japanese Prime Minister, Sanae Takaichi, stated Saturday that her country will “elevate the alliance” with the United States of America, after a “good and frank” telephone conversation with her counterpart Donald Trump. “With him, I am determined to elevate the Japan-USA alliance to even higher levels,” he wrote in a message published on the social network X, the day before Trump began a tour of Asia. The Japanese Prime Minister described the American President as “a very lively and fun person”. During this first telephone conversation with Trump, two days before his visit to Japan on Monday, Sanae Takaichi said that “one of the main priorities” of his administration was strengthening ties between the two countries “diplomatically and in terms of security”. Donald Trump wants Tokyo, as well as other allies, to increase their military spending and Sanae Takaichi announced on Friday, in her first political speech, that Japan would increase its defense budget to 2 percent of gross domestic product (GDP) in the next fiscal year, two years ahead of previous forecasts. President of the Liberal Democratic Party, conservative Sanae Takaichi is the first woman to hold the position of head of government in Japan, for which she was appointed on Tuesday.

item.title: Commercial exhibitions end with more than 140 agreements
item.description: The three trade exhibitions held in Macau ended on Friday with the signing of more than 140 cooperation agreements, said the organization, noting that 15 percent involve Portuguese-speaking countries. The 2nd China-Portuguese Speaking Countries Economic and Commercial Exhibition (C-PLPEX), the 30th Macau International Fair (MIF) and the 2025 Macau Franchise Exhibition (2025MFE), took place simultaneously, between Wednesday and Friday. The number of agreements signed during the four days registered “an increase of more than 30 percent compared to the previous year”, covering areas such as “integrated tourism and leisure, ‘big health’ of traditional Chinese medicine, cutting-edge technology, conventions and exhibitions, culture, sport, agricultural products, brand agency, Sino-Lusophone cooperation, among others”, said, in a statement, the Institute for the Promotion of Trade and Investment of Macau (IPIM). Still according to IPIM, 15 percent of these agreements involved Portuguese-speaking countries, “reflecting the value of the exhibitions in deepening economic and commercial cooperation between China and Portuguese-speaking countries”. On the other hand, IPIM also mentioned, almost 80 percent of the agreements signed were related to the '1+4' industries. The '1+4' model, created by the Government of Macau as a response to the need to diversify the territory's economy, which is deeply dependent on gambling, aims to focus on the following sectors: health and well-being industry, modern finance industry, cutting-edge technology industry and, finally, the conventions, exhibitions and commerce, culture and sports industry. IPIM, the note also reads, made more than 350 companies aware of the “investment environment and commercial advantages of Macau”. Investment intentions To date, 68 companies, including from Portugal and Brazil, “have already signed the declaration of investment intentions, which represents an increase of 70 percent year-on-year”. Furthermore, over these four days, more than 600 business representatives from Portuguese-speaking countries, Southeast Asia and various regions of mainland China visited Macau and the Deep Cooperation Zone, “in order to get to know its commercial areas and its commercial environment”. This year, C-PLPEX, MIF and MFE brought together more than 1,100 exhibitors from almost 30 countries, receiving more than 85 thousand participants, according to IPIM.

item.title: Paulo Maia and Carmo
item.description: Yelu Abaoji (872-926), the head of the nomadic Khitan people, a word translated as Qidan, contrary to tradition, decided to establish in his vast territory in 916 a dynasty in the style of the disintegrated Tang dynasty (618-907) and all the others that preceded it, with the succession of the maximum leader becoming hereditary and not a choice by a council tribal. He even went so far as, once again going against nomadic tradition, to build a «Supreme capital», Shangjing, Linhuangfu, designed in a grid pattern with streets aligned in the style of Chang’an, the capital of the Tang. And although it was the tribal military who made the decisions, Han civilians were chosen for state administration. He called this State Da Qidan and was posthumously given the title of Taizu Tian Huangdi, “Heavenly Emperor Taizu”. His successor would change the name of the dynasty to Liao and despite subsequent setbacks, this would be the name that would prevail. Abaoji had a son, Yelu Bei (899-937), whom he named Crown Prince and gave the title Renhuang Wang, «Imperial King of Men», handing him over the governance of the kingdom of Dongdan. And when the time for succession arrived, Yelu Bei naturally expected to inherit his father's title, but his mother, the ruthless Empress Dowager Shulu Ping (879-953), had other plans and with cold blood and cunning made the succession fall to another of her sons. What was improbable followed in Yelu Bei's life would be remembered years later by the poet, calligrapher and painter of the Yuan dynasty, Zhu Derun (1294-1365). Next to the figure of a horseman on a swift ride in the Deer Hunt on a horizontal scroll that was attributed to Yelu Bei (ink and color on paper, 24.6 x 79.9 cm, in the Metmuseum) he wrote: «To escape the persecution of Yelu Deguang (r. as Liao Taizong, 927-947) he crossed the sea and arrived at Dengzhou (in Shandong) and there he paid allegiance to Emperor Mingzong (r.925-933) of the Late Tang (923-936) and in return was granted the name Li and the commandership of Huaihai.” Li Zanhua would therefore be the name that Yelu Bei would use from then on. A name – Li – of enormous prestige because this was the name of the ruling family during the Tang dynasty, offered by Emperor Xianzong (r.805-820) to the founders of that second of the Five Dynasties period as a reward for their loyalty and which they carried, like the name Tang, with pride. Li Zanhua, wrote Zhu Derun, “used to take paintings and books with him when he traveled. He liked to paint knights with bows, on hunts or excursions. His clothes and accessories followed the rustic conventions of the barbarians because that was what he was used to and felt comfortable with. The way he used the brush was soft and fine while the dynamism of the men and horses corresponds to the spirit of the 8th century Tang. A painting that deserves to be appreciated.”

"Today, we realized a dream that began almost half a century ago, a vision of regional belonging that predates our own independence. I remember discussing this idea when I was a young man of 25", said the head of state, quoted in a statement released to the press. Timor-Leste joined ASEAN yesterday during the Asian organization's summit of heads of state and government, taking place in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, becoming its 11th member state. "When we formally presented the candidacy, in 2011, the path was not yet defined and required great perseverance. This success belongs to many", stated Ramos-Horta. The Nobel Peace Prize winner, who witnessed the moment of accession in Kuala Lumpur, expressed his “deep gratitude” to all ASEAN leaders and gave special recognition to the support of former Indonesian President Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono. "I also thank all Timorese leaders, past and present, including Prime Minister Xanana Gusmão, for their visionary leadership and tireless efforts to improve the well-being of our people. This is a victory for the entire nation, a moment of immense pride and shared achievement", added the Timorese President. ASEAN was created in 1967 by Indonesia, Singapore, Thailand, Malaysia and the Philippines, and was later joined by Brunei Darussalam, Cambodia, Laos, Myanmar and Vietnam. With 676.6 million inhabitants, ASEAN is the third most populous region in the world, after India and China.

item.title: Louvre | France to reinforce security at cultural sites after theft
item.description: The French Minister of Internal Affairs, Laurent Nuñez, will reinforce security measures in all cultural establishments, the press office announced yesterday, following a jewelry theft at the Louvre Museum in Paris. The decision was taken after a meeting with his government colleague in charge of Culture, Rachida Dati, said the same ministerial source, cited by the French news agency AFP. The institution, in the center of the French capital, remained closed yesterday, one day after a group, still at large, managed to steal multiple works of jewelry art. "The Louvre Museum will remain closed today (yesterday) for exceptional reasons. We apologize for the inconvenience", read a message published on the museum's official website. A group of four men stole jewelry on Sunday morning, in just a few minutes and when the museum was already open and with visitors inside, using a forklift machine, parked on the respective bank of the River Seine, and raising it to the height of a window on the first floor of the building. The group took eight pieces “of inestimable heritage value”, including the tiara of Empress Eugenie (wife of Napoleon III, emperor from 1852 to 1870) and two necklaces, the French Ministry of Culture reported on Sunday. That jewel alone has 212 pearls and 1,998 diamonds, according to the Louvre's description, while the pieces belonging to Queen Maria Amélia have multiple sapphires and hundreds of diamonds. This Parisian museum is the largest and most visited in the world, with nine million people enjoying part of the 35,000 works that the institution houses, in its 73 thousand square meters of space.

item.title: Cuts leave 13.7 million people at risk of extreme hunger
item.description: Cuts in humanitarian aid funding could expose up to 13.7 million people to extreme hunger around the world, the World Food Program (WFP) warned yesterday. “The humanitarian aid system is under severe pressure as partners withdraw from frontline areas, creating a void,” the Rome-based agency said in a new report titled “A lifebuoy in danger.” The UN agency said that six of its operations – in Afghanistan, the Democratic Republic of Congo, Haiti, Somalia, South Sudan and Sudan – are “facing major disruptions, which will only worsen”. WFP warned that its financing “has never been so challenging”, anticipating “a 40 percent drop” in 2025, “which will translate into a projected budget of US$6.4 billion, compared to US$10 billion in 2024”. The report does not name any countries, but points to a study published in the medical journal The Lancet, which found that 14 million additional deaths worldwide from disease, nutritional deficiencies and maternal and perinatal conditions could occur by 2030 as a result of cuts in US humanitarian aid alone. Returns and records Since US President Donald Trump's return to the White House, Washington has announced massive cuts in its foreign aid, dealing a huge blow to humanitarian operations around the world. "Program coverage has been significantly reduced and rations cut. Vital assistance to families in food disaster situations [Phase 5 of the Integrated Food Security Phase Classification/IPC] is threatened, while preparedness for future impacts has significantly decreased," warns WFP. Globally, “WFP estimates that its funding gaps could push 10.5 to 13.7 million people currently in acute food insecurity (IPC Phase 3) into a humanitarian emergency (IPC Phase 4),” the organization added. The UN agency said global hunger has now reached record levels, with 319 million people facing acute food insecurity — including 44 million at emergency levels.

item.title: Death | António Coelho dies aged 77, but leaves a legacy in Portuguese gastronomy
item.description: The founder of Restaurante António died on Sunday in Macau, due to heart problems. Behind him, he leaves a mark and an innovative concept for promoting Portuguese food in Asia A father, a friend and one of the great ambassadors of Portuguese gastronomy in Asia. Chef António Coelho died on Sunday, aged 77, due to heart problems, but leaves behind a professional career spanning almost 40 years and an influence that can be felt in several restaurants and Portuguese food chefs in Macau. Born in Portugal in 1948, António Coelho's first contact with Macau took place in 1970, when he had to complete his four-year mandatory military service. After two years, the land remained in his memory, but the future chef chose to return to Europe. In Portugal, he started working at Social Security, later moving to a clinical analysis laboratory. It was in this area that he developed his taste for gastronomy, not through work, but through various lunches and dinners in different restaurants. Increasingly interested in cooking, António decided to take a job, in 1984, in a restaurant, where he admitted to having learned to cook, according to an interview with the South China Morning Post newspaper, in 2018. The first years of António Coelho's new career were spent in Portugal, where he performed different roles as manager-administrator of the Botequim do Rei restaurant or director of the catering department at the Grande Hotel da Curia. In 1996, he had his first international experience, as director of the restaurant department at the Hotel Trópico, in Cape Verde. The experience lasts one year. Creating a legacy Returning to Macau in 1997, António worked for 10 years in different spaces, such as the restaurants Frol de la Mar, Lusitano, Lisbon, and also had a brief stay in Hong Kong, in 2002, at Restaurante Inn. However, the decisive step towards his affirmation as one of the most influential chefs of Portuguese gastronomy in Asia came in 2007, with the opening of Restaurante António. And the success that followed was not the result of chance, as said by Edgar Rodrigues, a chef who came to Macau to work on the launch of the project: “The success was based on the recipes, the quality of the food, but also the very professionalism”, says Edgar Rodrigues, to HM. "He was very attentive to his customers. If there was an order for clams à bolhão pato, he would have different recipes adapted to the nationality. For example, Koreans don't like coriander, the recipe for them didn't have coriander. Chinese customers like little salt, they were served with little salt, and locals like the more traditional recipe. In a single dish there were several ways of cooking, just to satisfy different customers", he recalls. Cristiano Tavares, currently chef at the Macalhau restaurant, also came to Macau to work at the António Restaurant. He believes that the chef found a position for Portuguese food that still influences other restaurants today. “I think his success was due to his way of being, he was a politically correct person, he had a way of working that pleased both Chinese, Korean and Japanese tourists”, explained Cristiano Tavares, to HM. "We were a street restaurant with four or five cooks. He managed to do what many large restaurants still cannot do today. Nowadays there are many restaurants with Portuguese food that open in Macau, but follow the example of what he did", he considered. Quality and spectacle In addition to the food, Restaurante António customers were seduced by the “show”. This is the vision of Marcelino Marques, António's friend and musician who for several years livened up the space's nights, with traditional Portuguese music. "The quality of the food made the space popular. He took great care in choosing the food and drinks served. He went to Portugal to choose wines from various regions, such as Douro or Alentejo, all of high quality, which were bottled under the António brand. People knew they weren't going to pay little, not that it was a space with luxury prices, it wasn't, but the quantity served wasn't small", recalled Marcelino Marques. However, the musician believes that the success was also due to a concept in which the meal was also a spectacle: "People liked listening to Portuguese music, but also being with António. He was an affable, big person and appeared in that white jacket with the flags of Portugal, China and Macau and people liked his presence and asked him to take photographs", he says. "He also opened a bottle of champagne with a sword. He did a whole ceremony and people really liked it. It was a spectacle and a party to see the cork flying out of the bottle. It worked well", he recalled. Marcelino Marques recorda que a comida e o espectáculo faziam com que o restaurante fosse muito famoso, principalmente entre turistas japoneses, coreanos e de Hong Kong. The musician reveals that Japanese tourists booked days in advance. E para este factor também contribuiu o facto de António oferecer no final das refeições um cálice de vinho do porto, o que também levou ao reconhecimento da Confraria do Vinho do Porto. The success of Restaurante António led the chef to sell the space to an investment fund, becoming an ambassador for the space. The break with the fund happened in 2020, when he was fired without just cause. The case ended up in court, with António winning the case. In recent years, António took on the position of executive chef at Angela’s Café and Lounge, at the Hotel Lisboeta. A father, a friend Due to his work in Macau, António was distinguished, in 2013, by the Macao SAR Government with the MSAR Tourist Merit Medal. Also in 2015, he received the merit medal for Portuguese communities from the Portuguese Government. However, for those who worked with him the most important thing was the relationship that went beyond the strictly professional field. "He had a big impact on Macau and for me he was like a second father. When I came to Macau I didn't have an easy life and he always held my hand", confessed Rodrigues. "He was always a person who was there for me. And I always saw him as a man of iron. In everything he did, there was a great will", he pointed out. This is a feeling shared by Cristiano Tavares. "António is my father in Macau. He worked until the last day, always with seriousness, honesty and integrity. He is an example for all the chefs in this area", he said. For Marcelino Marques, António's death is the loss of a friend. "António was the person who welcomed me to Macau and was capable of doing the same to everyone. He was strict and demanding, but he was an excellent person", he described. "Everyone knew him. He was an affable person and received people like no one else", he added.

item.title: Pop Mart, maker of Labubu, falls 10.8% in Hong Kong amid doubts about growth
item.description: Shares in Pop Mart, the Chinese company responsible for the global phenomenon of Labubu figures, sank 10.8% this Thursday, the biggest drop since April, in a new episode of volatility that contrasts with the good sales results released the day before. The devaluation reflects investors' growing caution regarding the possibility of a slowdown in the company's growth, after several quarters driven by the popularity of its collectible products. On Wednesday, Pop Mart shares rose 4.23% on the Hong Kong stock exchange, despite the negative tone of the market, following the announcement that revenue in the third quarter increased between 245% and 250%, driven by Labubu's virality on social media and the company's international expansion. According to data provided by the company, domestic sales grew 190%, while international sales soared 370%, highlighted by increases of 175% in the Asia-Pacific region, more than 740% in Europe and almost 1,270% in the United States. The strong drop recorded today is largely attributed to profit taking, after appreciation of more than 186% since the beginning of the year, and uncertainty about the sustainability of the current growth rate. The stock fell 8.1% on Tuesday, its worst performance since April, weighed down by fears of a slowdown in sales after months of euphoria. The preliminary release of results helped to temporarily dispel these concerns, but the absence of an official date for the presentation of the accounts maintains uncertainty regarding the company's future evolution. Executive chairman and founder Wang Ning expressed confidence in the long-term resilience of the Labubu character, arguing that cultural icons continue to generate revenue even after peak popularity. According to the Bloomberg agency, the explosion in demand forced the company itself to revise its internal goals upwards. If at the beginning of 2024 Pop Mart predicted a turnover of 2,800 million dollars (around 2,400 million euros), in August Wang raised this target to 4,200 million dollars (3,600 million euros), pointing to the brand's global momentum as a key factor. Founded in Beijing in 2010, Pop Mart has established itself as one of the main Asian references in the toy and collectible figures sector, combining exclusive design, limited editions and collaborations with international brands, artists and franchises. Its business model is based on so-called “surprise boxes”, which encourage repeat purchases and have created a community of fans willing to pay high premiums for rare pieces. Among its main lines is Labubu, a monster with pointy ears and a mischievous smile inspired by Norse mythology, created by Hong Kong artist Lung Ka-sing in 2015 and integrated into the company's portfolio in 2019.

item.title: Chemistry | Nobel Prize for the development of metal-organic structures
item.description: The Nobel Prize in Chemistry was awarded to Susumu Kitagawa, from Kyoto University, Richard Robson, from the University of Melbourne, and Omar M. Yaghi, from the University of California, “for the development of metal-organic structures”, the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences announced yesterday. Susumu Kitagawa, Richard Robson and Omar Yaghi have developed a new form of molecular architecture – metal-organic frameworks – that can be used to collect water from desert air, capture carbon dioxide, store toxic gases or catalyze chemical reactions. The three laureates created molecular constructs with large spaces through which gases and other chemicals could flow. The president of the Nobel Committee for Chemistry, Heiner Linque, highlighted precisely the fact that these “metal-organic structures have enormous potential, bringing previously unforeseen opportunities for personalized materials with new functions”. The research that led to the discovery of this new form of molecular architecture began nearly four decades ago, in 1989, when Richard Robson tested the use of the inherent properties of atoms by combining positively charged copper ions with a four-armed molecule. When combined, they bonded "to form a spacious, well-ordered crystal. It was like a diamond filled with countless cavities," the academy explains. Robson immediately realized the potential of his molecular construction, but it was still unstable and crumbled easily. It was chemists Susumu Kitagawa and Omar Yaghi who managed to provide a solid foundation for this construction method. Notable applications Following the discoveries of the three laureates, chemists built tens of thousands of different MOFs. Some of them could contribute to solving some of humanity's biggest challenges, with applications including breaking down traces of pharmaceuticals in the environment, capturing carbon dioxide or collecting water from desert air. The discovery also allows the separation of perfluoroalkylated and polyfluoroalkylated substances (PFAS) from water. PFAS are a group of synthetic chemical compounds known as “forever chemicals” due to their extreme persistence in the environment and in the human body. PFAS are used in a wide range of industrial and household products, such as stain- and water-resistant textiles, food packaging, non-stick cookware and firefighting foams. Its accumulation in the environment and potential health risks, including liver damage and other problems, have led to concerns and a search for safer alternatives.

item.title: Study | Trump was the main disseminator of disinformation in the USA in 2024
item.description: North American President Donald Trump was the main disseminator of disinformation in the United States of America (USA) in 2024, concluded a study by the International Center for Journalists (ICFJ). “US President Donald Trump was the dominant source and distributor of disinformation” in 2024, say the authors of the study “Disarming Disinformation: United States”. The study highlights that Trump has drawn on the functions of domestic political forces, rather than foreign state actors, as the main source of disinformation narratives in US political discourse. Furthermore, the existence of WhatsApp groups and other closed digital spaces often act as “information cocoons” that encourage rumors and other forms of misinformation. In this way, "the viral spread of misinformation and the strategic attack on journalists have emerged as interconnected threats to democracy. In an era of increasing authoritarianism and democratic backsliding, falsehoods are often used as a weapon by state actors to influence public opinion, undermine journalism and intimidate journalists." The study authors state that these factors are increasingly the North American reality, with Donald Trump “promulgating manifestly false narratives” in recent years. “The American media faces a profound information crisis, at a time of repression of freedom of expression”, the study reads. In this sense, trust in the mainstream press continues to decline in a climate of increasing attacks on the media by the Trump Government. The study published by the International Center for Journalists (ICFJ) was based on the analysis of 10,000 news and media publications during 2024, as well as a survey of 1,020 Americans.

item.title: Scientists ‘reduce’ the age of the Egyptian temple of Karnak, in Egypt
item.description: Researchers have carried out the most comprehensive geoarchaeological study of the Karnak temple, near Luxor, and revealed suggestive links to ancient Egyptian mythology and new data about the interaction between the complex's riverine landscape and the people who occupied the site during its almost 3,000 years of use. The results of the investigation were published on Monday in Antiquity magazine, reported the Efe news agency. Researchers from the University of Southampton, in the United Kingdom, and Uppsala University, in Sweden, participated in the study. Up to 61 sediment samples from the interior and surroundings of the temple and thousands of ceramic fragments found in the Karnak complex, located 500 meters east of the current Nile River, near Luxor, in the ancient Egyptian religious capital of Thebes, were analyzed. The researchers mapped how the landscape around the site changed throughout its history and found that, before 2520 BC, the site could not have been suitable for permanent occupation due to periodic flooding caused by the Nile's strong currents. Therefore, they placed the earliest occupation at Karnak during the Old Kingdom (between 2591 and 2152 BC). Pottery fragments found at the site corroborate this discovery, with the oldest dating between 2305 and 1980 BC. Therefore, the conclusions of this international team of researchers provide new evidence about the age of Karnak, which has been hotly debated in archaeological circles for decades. The origin of everything The ground on which the temple was founded was formed when river channels advanced west and east, creating an island of high ground in what is now the east-southeast region of the site. This emerging island laid the foundation for the occupation and initial construction of Karnak. Over the following centuries and millennia, the river channels on both sides of the site diverged further, creating more space for the development of the temple complex, as researchers have now confirmed. This new understanding of the temple's landscape bears striking similarities to an ancient Egyptian creation myth, leading the team to believe that the decision to locate the temple there may have been related to the religious views of its inhabitants. Ancient Egyptian texts from the Old Kingdom indicate that the 'Creator God' manifested himself as high ground emerging from the lake, and researchers have found that the island where Karnak was founded is the only known area of ​​high ground surrounded by water in the region. Thus, archaeologists have suggested that the Theban elites chose the location of Karnak to be the abode of a new form of 'Creator God', alluding to Amun-Ra, the supreme god of ancient Egypt, since the location fit perfectly into the mythological setting of the highlands that emerged from the surrounding waters as the origin of the formation of the Universe.

item.title: Education | Defended creation of learning vouchers
item.description: Chan Lai Kei, a deputy linked to the Fujian community, questioned the Government about the idea of ​​creating learning vouchers, outside the education system, which would be awarded annually to students with economic difficulties, in order to alleviate the burden on families. According to a written statement, the deputy argued that, currently, the subsidies granted by the Government take place in a school context, but the courses available in schools may not meet the needs of all students. In turn, the Continuous Development and Improvement Programme, aimed at courses outside the school system, is only aimed at residents over 15 years old, meaning that anyone aged between 6 and 14 has to pay for courses outside of school in full, without any support. According to Chan Lai Kei, the lack of financial support in this area means that there are limitations to the development of students' potential, also making improvements in terms of social diversity and the achievement of greater educational equity in the long term difficult.

item.title: Macau Forum | Promoted digital economy in colloquium
item.description: The “Colloquium on Digital Economy between China and Portuguese-speaking Countries” ended on Friday. The event kicked off on October 13th and was promoted by Forum Macau, with the secretary-general, Ji Xianzheng, stating that the event aimed to promote “new technologies, such as artificial intelligence and the digital economy, with the aim of promoting the digitalization of trade and investment in countries participating in Forum Macau”. Furthermore, in his speech, Ji Xianzheng highlighted the importance of “fostering technological innovation and the modernization of cross-border industrial cooperation”. Forum Macau also highlights, in the same note, that this colloquium “allowed to speed up and encourage the parties involved to jointly explore the opportunities provided by the digital economy, overcoming risks and challenges, supporting business development and achieving mutual benefits”. Ensa Indjai, as rotating representative of the colloquium, “expressed that China has shown the world the strength of its digital integration strategy, artificial intelligence and new technologies, opening paths for strengthening relations with Portuguese-speaking countries”.

item.title: Recycled Water | Target of 10 percent set
item.description: The government intends that “in the long term” around 10 percent of the water consumed in Macau will be recycled. The goal was reiterated yesterday, through a statement from the office of the Secretary for Transport and Public Works. “The medium-term goal is for recycled water consumption to represent 5 percent of Macau’s total water consumption, with the long-term goal to exceed 10 percent”, it was announced. This is seen as a way to “further save precious water resources, create greater value for its sustainable development and build a Macau city more oriented towards water saving”. According to the same statement, “Macau faces a significant shortage of fresh water” and 99 percent of the raw water consumed comes from the interior. The same data indicates that since the end of 1999, “the demand for water has registered a sharp increase, the volume of raw water supplied to Macau in 2024 reached around 105 million cubic meters, which represents an increase of more than 83 percent”.

item.title: Economy | Nick Lei asks for new consumption card
item.description: In a written interpellation, deputy Nick Lei asked the Government to study the possibility of granting another round of the consumption card, similar to what happened during the pandemic. According to the legislator linked to the Fujian community, the elderly and disabled have great difficulties using the current model of encouraging consumption, which adopts a discount policy. Previously, the card allocated an amount that could be used, regardless of any spending by the elderly. According to the deputy, if the Government is unable to issue a consumer card to all citizens, it should at least support vulnerable groups, such as the elderly, disabled and people with lower incomes. The law also asks the Executive to carry out a study on the effectiveness of the current model.

item.title: Five Year Plan | Chan Meng Kam defends bet on Hengqin
item.description: With the start of the 15th national Five-Year Plan next year, businessman and former deputy Chan Meng Kam publicly defended the need to invest more in the Mountain Island, to promote the diversification of Macau's economy. In statements cited by the newspaper Ou Mun, Chan Meng Kam highlighted the advantages of diversifying the economy and exploring Hengqin, pointing out that since the adoption of Macau's vehicle circulation policy in Guangdong, the daily lives of residents are no longer limited to the Macao SAR and now encompass a one-hour travel radius, within the national Greater Bay Area project. In turn, businessman and now deputy Kevin Ho praised the economic policy efforts of governments in recent years, with what he indicated was a reduction in the gaming sector's proportion in Gross Domestic Product (GDP) to less than 40 percent. This is a reduction that could be accentuated from December onwards, when several satellite casinos will close their doors, by decision of the Government and deputies. Kevin Ho also addressed the national 15th Five-Year Plan, to state that the role that the Macao SAR must assume in the country's development is increasingly clear. The businessman thus left hope that diversification efforts in areas such as leisure tourism, traditional Chinese medicine and modern finance will increasingly materialize.

item.title: Salaries | Proposed increase of one pataca per hour
item.description: On the table, there was a discussion of an increase in the minimum wage of between one and three patacas per hour. The Executive led by Sam Hou Fai opted for the lower amount. The decision was justified with “the balance of a set of factors” After discussion by the Executive Council, the Government proposes an increase of one pataca per hour in the minimum wage. On the table was the possibility of increasing between one and three patacas, and the government opted for a lower growth rate. The proposal was revealed on Friday, through a press conference by the Executive Council, whose new spokesperson is Wong Sio Chak, now Secretary for Administration and Justice. According to the proposal, the hourly wage will rise from 34 patacas to 35 patacas, representing an increase of 2.9 percent. Regarding the daily calculation, the Executive Council presented the increase as an increase from 272 patacas to 280 patacas, taking into account eight hours of work. In weekly terms, the current salary of 1,632 patacas will increase to 1,680 patacas, while on a monthly basis the increase is from 7,072 patacas to 7,280 patacas. According to the Executive, the proposal was based on “the balance of a set of factors, namely the employers' business environment, the guarantee of workers' rights and interests and the ability of consumers to accept them”. Official estimates indicate that the increase will cover “around 18,200 people”, which means 4.4 percent of all workers, excluding domestic workers. Deletion defended At the press conference, the Government of Sam Hou Fai also defended the need for domestic workers to have a salary below the minimum wage. The position shows that Sam will not change this policy, maintaining Ho Iat Seng's options. The position was explained by the director of the Services for Labor Affairs (DSAL), Chan Un Tong: “When the law was established, the main premise was the ‘unique nature’ of domestic work and the need for the worker to ‘integrate’ into the employer’s family life”, explained Chan Un Tong. “However, even if this legislation does not apply to them, this does not mean that their rights are not protected”, he argued. Currently, DSAL allows the hiring of non-resident workers as domestic workers, as long as there is a minimum wage of 3,200 patacas. However, Chan pointed out that the median salary is around 3,800 patacas. Given this value, the director of DSAL considered that practice shows that even for these workers “there are mechanisms that guarantee reasonable remuneration”. JSF/Lusa

item.title: TDM | Inês Chan deixa empresa ao fim de três meses
item.description: After five years as director of the Social Communication Office, Inês Chan took on the role of administrator at TDM. Three months later, the mandate has now come to an end. Several TDM administrators have had their terms expired since the end of August About three months after assuming the role of member of the Board of Directors of TDM – Teledifusao de Macau, Inês Chan Lou left the company. According to HM, the departure is due to the fact that the civil servant has chosen to retire. Appointed in July this year to TDM, after leaving the Social Communication Office (GCS), where she was director and where she still has no replacement, Inês Chan is now no longer listed as a company administrator on the portal of the Directorate of Supervision and Public Asset Management Services (DSSGAP). This is the portal that disseminates information about companies with capital from the Macao SAR. Previously, Inês appeared on the list with the remunerations of members of the bodies appointed by the Chief Executive, with a salary of 1.36 million patacas per year, the second highest in the company, just behind Lo Song Man, vice-president of the company who has a salary of 1.40 million patacas. Inês Chan had a contract until August 2026. However, this was not the only change, Inês Chan Lou's name was also no longer present on the TDM portal, in the area dedicated to the contacts of administrators who were part of the Executive Committee. HM contacted Lo Song Man to obtain clarification about Chan's departure, but by press time he had not received a response to the email sent. The Social Communication Office was also contacted, as Inês Chan had been appointed Chief Executive, to understand the contours of a departure that would take place around three months after the appointment, but also did not receive a response before closing time. To be renewed In relation to appointments for TDM – Macau Television, the DSSGAP portal shows that the mandates of several members of the Board of Directors came to an end in August this year. The terms of office of the president, António José de Freitas, vice-president, Lo Song Man, and administrators Cristina Ho Hoi Leng, Vong Hin Fai, Ma Kam Keong, Un Weng Kuai, Vong Vai Hung and Cheang Kong Pou expired at the end of August. However, members of the Board of Directors may continue to hold office, because in accordance with the company's statutes when there is no new appointment, or directors may choose to remain in office. In addition to being administrators, Lo Song Man, Ma Kam Keong, Un Weng Kuai, Vong Vai Hung and Cheang Kong Pou are also members of the Executive Committee. HM questioned the Social Communication Office about the reasons why the Chief Executive had not yet renewed the members' mandates, or appointed new members, but by closing time he had not received a response either.

item.title: What has this come to?
item.description: A 14-year-old minor kills his mother with his father's gun. We have become accustomed to reading sad news about children who steal their mother's jewelry for certain vices or who beat their mother or father because they don't give them money to buy drugs. Now the red line has been crossed. A minor says that “my mother bothered me a lot”, takes his father's gun and kills his mother without appeal or aggravation. What this has come to. The mother, Susana Gravato, 49 years old, was a PSD councilor at the Vagos City Council. The court has already decided to commit the minor to a closed regime and he may then remain in the same situation for another three years. The minor committed the crime in such a conscious way that, after the act, he even simulated a robbery scenario at home. When we spoke to a psychologist, she told us that the change in children's education these days is terrifying. That social networks are one of the reasons why violence is becoming commonplace and that legislation needs to change a lot with regard to access to digital. Miguel Sousa Tavares defended the gradual ban on social networks, stressing that “They are ruining our way of life”. We live in a time of education through conditioned reflex, added the psychologist, to continue highlighting "that perhaps because we are being overtaken by dogs. We live in a time where everything is the consequence of a pseudo-trauma that ignorance can easily treat and that does nothing but prolong and worsen the disease." We read Freud very early on, and we soon realized that, in Freud, almost everything revolved around frustration and repressed sex. Then, as was fashionable, we read Piaget thinking it would help us educate our children. We were wrong. Piaget educated, but he taught us. We discovered that educating children is not limited to theories, religions or fashions. Raising children, first and foremost, must be an act of love, otherwise the reverse side of the coin could be fatal. In fact, the country, once considered peaceful, was shocked to learn that a daughter tried to stab her father to death and gouge out his eyes to simply keep a house, and the next day, a 14-year-old son killed his mother with his father's hidden pistol because “his mother was boring with her schoolwork”. Right, that is to say that he immediately “killed” his father and killed himself too. Madness contaminates and so does evil. They are identical twins. The Portuguese did not want to believe that the red line had been crossed and that now children were killing their parents. A few years ago, we met José Manuel Anes, who was president of the Criminal Security and Terrorism Observatory. A man experienced in all aspects of life, security, crime and espionage. We cannot understand what education Anes gave his daughter Ana, so that she tried to stab him to death and had the “courage” to go on social media to say that she tried to kill her father because he had collaborated with the Mossad. It's incomprehensible from a daughter. José Manuel Anes had told us that the position he held was a risky one, that he was aware that one day he could be killed, but he certainly never imagined that this could happen at the hands of his own daughter Ana, who is already in prison and who confessed to the crime. Indeed, the world has changed, and for the worse in terms of the attitudes of the new generations. Parents' fault? Perhaps. However, it is still repugnant that a 53-year-old daughter takes a knife and tries to kill her father who gave her everything including an allowance until the day he was seriously attacked. What this has come to. José Manuel Anes was attacked inside his own house. Five years ago, Anes was persecuted by his daughter, with death threats on social media. The daughter intended for her father to put ownership of a house in Costa de Caparica in her name. Daughter Ana Anes' theory was that she would be able to sell the house and raise the money, since she would be unemployed. This is the motive behind the crime determined by the Judiciary Police investigation. Furthermore, it was because he feared that his daughter would carry out the threats that José Manuel Anes, aged 81, began living with his current wife in the house of one of her friends, in Lisbon. Anes had received a threatening message from his daughter before the day of the crime and the very next day she rang the door of the house where she was living and Anes opened it, thinking it was the delivery of a package. He was immediately thrown to the ground by his daughter, who then attacked him with several punches all over his body. Then, with a sharp object, he hit him on the head, legs, hands and abdomen, until, finally, he pressed both of his eyes with his fingers, leaving him unable to see. What a macabre scene: a daughter who tries to kill an 81-year-old father, just for the sake of money. On any given day, every month we have a father killed by a son. What this has come to… P.S. – This was my 250th column. I would like to fraternally thank Director Carlos Morais José for the invitation he made to me about five years ago to be in contact with the readers of this magnificent newspaper.

item.title: Global Strategic Triangle (I)
item.description: (Continued from October 23rd edition) Exaggerating the Russian threat serves both industry and domestic politics. At the lower end of the scale, Palestinians continue to be targets of extermination and displacement by Jerusalem, in a persistent search for living space. They are forgotten victims, especially by those who call themselves their friends. The crisis of social cohesion in the triangle of regional powers is evident. In Israel, internal fragmentation is dramatic. External wars function as an escape valve to avoid internal collapse between centrifugal tribes, where the retreat of ultra-Orthodox Jews to fight for the Zionists is more than alarming. In Iran, tension is latent, the result of the progressive secularization of society and the regime, which the West continues to attribute to the ayatollahs as a caricature that is not amusing, and the collapse of the birth rate. In Türkiye, the situation is manageable, despite the growing gap between the regime's pragmatic Islamism and the secular, almost atheist, widespread among young people. The fertility rate fell from 2.38 children per woman in 2001 to 1.48 in 2024, a sign of a profound demographic transition. As for the triangle of great powers, the United States maintains interest only to avoid Israel's self-destruction, caused by unwinnable wars. But the commitment is decreasing. Trump does not trust Netanyahu, who tries to instrumentalize him, but depends on him for weapons. Israeli extravagances are tolerated, as the American interest lies in supervising the balance between the three protagonists, the United States, Russia and China in addition to Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates, converted to the open field game, with China and even Iran. The red line of the Persian bomb, with Saudi and Turkish consequences, remains a point of tension. With no other perspective than to push everyone further. Russia has recently rediscovered its Soviet-era Middle Eastern partners, starting with Syria, trying to open a southwestern breach in the American device west of the vertical Murmansk-Cairo eastern border of the American sphere of influence in the post-global era. The fall of al-Assad dealt a severe blow to Russian influence in the region. Moscow is trying to defend access to its only naval base in the Mediterranean, reduced but not compromised. Putin strengthens military and energy ties with Iran, as the Ukrainians well know, the target of swarms of Persian drones, while negotiating with Saudi Arabia, together with the Americans, the price of oil. Erdogan extends his provinces to almost all of Libya, while offering ambiguous support in the Black Sea and in secret negotiations over Ukraine. But the rivalry between the Second and Third Rome is destined to last until the last days. Finally, the strategic triangle between Israel, Turkey and Iran in the Middle East, between Suez, Bab al-Mandab and Hormuz, adds a layer of complexity to the global panorama. They are islands of strong identity in a sea of ​​para-States and fragmented communities, where stability is always relative. The war in Ukraine, far from being an isolated episode, is a mirror of a world in transition. A world where the balance between powers, the redefinition of alliances and the management of regional conflicts will determine the course of history. And where peace, more than an ideal, will be the result of patient and multilateral diplomatic engineering.

item.title: Global Strategic Triangle (I)
item.description: “The divergence between American and European strategic analysis is more instrumental than sincere.” José Milhazes The war in Ukraine is not just a regional tragedy. It is the reflection of a systemic transition that crosses the world, where the balance between powers, alliances and civilizations is being reconfigured. The conflict, although localized, contains three interconnected dimensions that make it one of the most significant events of the post-Cold War era. The first dimension, visceral and immediate, is the bloodiest. It is a confrontation between what remains of the Russian empire, driven by a drive for historical greatness, and the Ukrainian nation, which seeks to assert itself as a sovereign and independent state, free from Moscow influence. This struggle, which mixes elements of civil war with post-Soviet succession disputes, is marked by imperial memories, historical resentments and national ambitions. Ukraine, in trying to consolidate its political and cultural identity, directly challenges the Russian narrative of Slavic unity and imperial continuity. The second dimension, more structural and continental in scope, involves the Euro-Atlantic space in a process of transformation. Since the collapse of the Soviet Union, the expansion of Western influence eastward has been constant. The integration of the former East Germany, the accession of the Baltic countries, Poland, Romania and, more recently, Finland and Sweden to NATO, outline a path towards approaching the Russian border. Moscow's military offensive against Kiev appears as a reaction to this eastern march, trying to prevent Ukraine from becoming an advanced platform for American influence. From this perspective, Ukrainian fighters become pieces on a larger board, where Washington projects power through alliances and indirect support. The rhetoric of the “collective West”, although used as an instrument of internal mobilization by Russia, proves to be useful in giving the intervention the status of a patriotic war. The third dimension, quieter but decisive, is part of the systemic challenge between global powers. Ukraine has become a testing ground for the resilience of alliances, the effectiveness of containment strategies, and the ability of great powers to adapt. The conflict draws a geometry of pairs with Ukraine and the United States on one side; Russia and its strategic partners on the other. China, although not directly involved, observes with attention and prudence, calibrating its movements on a board where regional stability and strategic autonomy are priorities. Its stance, marked by moderation and pragmatism, helps to avoid an uncontrolled escalation and preserves channels of dialogue that could be crucial for an eventual resolution. In this scenario, the war in Ukraine contains the ingredients for a global escalation, if one of the vertices of the geopolitical triangle Washington, Moscow or Beijing decides to break the tacit balance. The only sustainable solution seems to lie in an understanding between these three powers, capable of preventing Kiev from becoming the stage for a new global war, similar to those that marked the last century. Europe, for its part, is watching the tragedy unfold with increasing apathy. Its eastern border burns, but the European public, tired and divided, hesitates between involvement and distancing. Ukraine, technically bankrupt and dependent on foreign aid, sees half of its population living in the diaspora. Those who remain face a war of survival, aware that total victory is unlikely. The tacit aim appears to be to weaken Russia, even if this means eroding European stability. NATO's northeastern front, centered in Poland and extending from the Arctic to the Black Sea, emerges as a possible flashpoint. Germany, with its historical memory and geopolitical responsibility, will be decisive in the reconstruction of post-conflict Ukraine. Its influence, discreet but profound, contrasts with Polish assertiveness, marked by regional rivalries. On the horizon, a Korean-style ceasefire scenario can be seen, with a new steel curtain dividing the country. The reconstruction will be shared among the Western allies, with demarcated fiefdoms and crossed interests. Russia, in turn, will be able to consolidate a New Russia, extending from Transnistria to the Baltic, paying homage to the tsars who projected the empire towards Europe. The logic of military capabilities, more than declared intentions, fuels the possibility of preventive confrontations. Tactical nuclear escalation, although unwanted, becomes an almost automatic consequence in an environment of mutual distrust. The cautious United States prefers to shift its focus to the Indo-Pacific, while the Europeans, torn between ambitions and resentment, face the dilemma of rearming without the American nuclear umbrella. The strategic divergence between Americans and Europeans is more functional than ideological. In Washington, the partial withdrawal from Europe is seen as an opportunity to redistribute resources and test the autonomy of allies. In Europe, this withdrawal is interpreted as an opportunity to reconfigure ambitions and settle historical accounts. (Continues)

item.title: Contributing a vivid example of China's governance to advancing the global cause of women
item.description: By Liu Xianfa Commissioner of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the People's Republic of China in the Macau Special Administrative Region The Global Leaders' Meeting on Women, with the theme “A Shared Future: New and Accelerated Process for the Integral Development of Women”, took place in Beijing, from 13 to 14 October, in commemoration of the 30th anniversary of the IV World Conference on Women and with a view to discussing the development of the global cause of women. President Xi Jinping attended the opening ceremony of the Meeting and delivered the keynote speech entitled “Carrying Forward the Spirit of the Beijing World Conference on Women and Promoting the New and Accelerated Process for Women's All-Round Development”, in which he comprehensively and systematically demonstrated the achievements of Chinese modernization and the cause of women in New Era China, presented China's proposals for accelerating the new process of women's all-round development in light of global trends and announced China's solutions to further support the development of women's global cause. With successful practices and fruitful achievements, China has contributed to the whole world yet another vivid example of “Chinese governance”. In China, the cause of women has always constituted an important part of the Chinese modernization process. Since its founding in 1921, the Communist Party of China has been committed to women's liberation and gender equality. After the establishment of the People's Republic of China, a series of laws and regulations were enacted that protected women's rights and interests, achieving historic improvements in women's status in terms of education, employment, political participation and marital autonomy. Entering the new era, the CPC Central Committee, with Comrade Xi Jinping as the core, has emphasized safeguarding women's legitimate rights and interests, promoting gender equality and women's all-round development as integral components of Chinese modernization. A series of pioneering, general and long-term decisions and plans have been made, and the cause of China's women has made historic achievements and changes. We won the greatest battle against poverty in human history and thus brought moderate prosperity to 690 million women. We have reduced the maternal mortality rate by nearly 80% since 1995 and have joined leading upper-middle-income countries in key maternal and child health indicators. Currently, women represent more than 40% of China's total workforce and more than half of the country's internet startup entrepreneurs. In the new era, Chinese women, more confident and vibrant, participate in the entire governance process of the country and society. The cause of women in China has enjoyed wider development spaces and more promising prospects than ever before. After his return to his homeland, Macau experienced a golden age in the development of women's causes. The educational level, labor market participation, industrial coverage, professional level and income of women in Macau have improved significantly. With great courage and enthusiasm, Women have made significant contributions in all spheres of life, supporting half the sky for the development of Macau. Since 2008, the Macau General Women's Association obtained special consultative status with the United Nations Economic and Social Council, thus being officially qualified by the United Nations to assist in international affairs and, since then, it has participated in the sessions of the Commission on the Status of Women (CSW) for 15 consecutive years. Macau has already become an indispensable force in telling the stories of China and Macau's successful practice of “one country, two systems” among the international community. China has given firm support and active contribution to the development of the global cause of women. As President Xi Jinping has highlighted, women play an important role in the creation, promotion and development of human civilization, and the international community has a shared responsibility to advance the cause of women. China upholds the vision of building a community with a shared future for humanity and has transformed the Global Development Initiative, the Global Security Initiative, the Global Civilization Initiative and the Global Governance Initiative into concrete actions to promote the all-round development of women, so as to actively provide opportunities and support for the global cause of women through their development. China actively participates in global governance in the field of women, supports the United Nations in prioritizing women's work, creates the Prize for the Education of Girls and Women in partnership with UNESCO and has announced three donations of 10 million dollars to UN Women. In the face of global challenges, China has sent more than 1,200 female officers and military personnel to participate in UN peacekeeping operations, providing humanitarian assistance to women and children affected by conflicts and disasters. China has been deepening global exchanges and cooperation between women, maintaining friendly relations with women's organizations and institutions in more than 140 countries, implementing projects worth more than 40 million dollars in the women's sector in more than 20 countries, cultivating more than 200,000 female talents in more than 180 countries and regions, and providing assistance for women's employment in more than 100 countries. The development of women's cause in China has provided a referenceable Chinese solution to the global women's cause, which is widely recognized and praised by the international community. Renewing our dedication to the purpose of the Beijing World Conference on Women and joining forces to create a better future for the advancement of the global cause of women. Globally, gender-based violence, digital inequality and the shadow of war and conflict still persist. Looking to the future, we must renew ourselves in favor of the purpose of the Beijing World Conference on Women to build greater consensus, expand the paths forward and take more concrete measures, with the aim of accelerating the new process of women's integral development.
